texts: Children in the Wini Bruma Kindergarden
Patrocino, Joel, Noel, Bernadete, Jenildo, Narlia, Monica cessy, Berta pinto, Teodoru, Vidal, Lindalva, Odilton
My family lives in Timor-Leste, where many different plants grow.
I give water to the plants so they can grow well.
Clovers and trees also drink the water I give them and grow.
When the trees grow big, special fruits that are only in Timor-Leste also grow.
To help the flowers and fruits grow well, we need to collect trash well.
Trash looks dirty. But why should we collect it well?
If we collect trash well, we can recycle it. For example, a wonderful flower pot like this.
It can also become a cool trash can by the sea.
So, we need to collect trash well to live together with nature.
This is a rule for people and nature to live together! Please put trash in the right place.
